Description: Travertine amphora; rim thickened with rounded exterior; short cylindrical neck; body with rounded shoulder and slightly curved walls; disc base; two horizontal loop handles on shoulders, drilled through from underside; black painted decoration comprising double framed row of petals around upper neck and semi-circular floral garland on shoulder; paint preserved on one side only; vessel partially reconstructed and chips missing from rim; drilled and ground.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Enkomi
Curator's comments: See Aston 1994 for comprehensive study and classification of Egyptian stone vessels. Bevan 2007, 134-43 provides an overview of Egyptian stone vessels, with a discussion of the cultural impact on Cyprus on pp. 152-153. Bibliography: Aston B. 1994, Ancient Egyptian stone vessels: Materias and forms (Heidelberg: Heidelberg Orientverlag). Bevan A. 2007, Stone vessels and values in the Bronze Age Mediterranean (Cambridge: Cambridge University Press).
Bibliographic references: Jacobsson 1994 / Aegyptiaca from Late Bronze Age Cyprus (No. 33)
Murray, Smith and Walters 1900 / Excavations in Cyprus (p.25, Fig 43)
Peltenburg 1986 / Ramesside Egypt and Cyprus (P. 161, No.3)
